author: Ethan Bronner
description: President Donald Trump’s new plan to end the Gaza war is, in essence, an ultimatum to Hamas to release hostages, give up arms and surrender — or face the full force of the Israeli military with the US’s explicit blessing.
title: Trump’s Pro-Israel Gaza Plan Seen as Unlikely to Win Over Hamas

author: William Standring, Ellen Milligan, Alex Wickham
description: Theresa May danced to ABBA. Rishi Sunak had his wife introduce him. Liz Truss spent the whole time scrapping budget measures announced only days before.
title: Starmer Seeks Political Redemption by Taking on Farage Threat

author: Gregory Korte
description: The Trump administration will carry ahead with investigations into certain imports during a possible government shutdown, allowing them to move forward on laying the groundwork for further tariffs.
title: Trump to Keep Tariff Probes Running Through Government Shutdown

author: Erik Wasson
description: Looming federal government shutdowns have become almost routine in Washington. In March, Congress was just days away from a partial shutdown before lawmakers reached a spending deal to fund parts of the government. It was another instance of Congress putting off hard decisions until the last minute.
title: Another US Government Shutdown Looms. Here’s Why It Keeps Happening.

author: Joe Deaux
description: The Trump administration is looking at adopting a tool more familiar to Wall Street than Washington, as it seeks equity holdings in producers of critical minerals to bolster supply chains deemed essential to national security.
title: Trump Team Eyes Wall Street Tool to Add Clout in Vital Minerals

author: Peter Blumberg, Jamie Tarabay
description: President Donald Trump has repeatedly deployed the US military for domestic assignments. In June, he summoned the Guard and the Marines to Los Angeles — over the objections of local leaders — to subdue protests against his administration’s mass arrests of migrants. In August, Trump called up the Guard to combat violent street crime in Washington, DC. On Sept. 15, the president announced plans for a National Guard deployment to Memphis, and on Sept. 27, he ordered troops to Portland, Oregon.
title: Why Trump’s Use of Military in US Is So Controversial

author: Peter Blumberg, Zoe Tillman
description: Google agreed to pay $24.5 million to resolve Donald Trump’s claims that being banished from his YouTube channel after the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the US Capitol was illegal censorship, according to a court filing.
title: Google to Pay $24.5 Million to End Trump Suit Over Jan. 6 Ban

author: Miranda Davis
description: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker said that the state’s National Guard has been formally notified of a federal request to deploy 100 troops to protect immigration officers and facilities, in the latest expansion of the Trump administration’s use of military resources in US cities.
title: Pritzker Says Trump Is Deploying 100 Guard Troops to Illinois

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump, Democrats Take Shutdown Standoff Down to the Wire

author: Emily Birnbaum, Erik Wasson, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Vice President JD Vance said he believes the US government is on track to shut down, seeking to pin the blame on Democrats one day before federal funding is set to lapse.
title: Vance Says US Headed for Shutdown After Talks With Democrats

description: President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said during a press conference Monday they had agreed to a 20-point plan designed to end the war in Gaza.
title: Read Trump’s 20-Point Plan to End War in Gaza

author: Liam Knox
description: The US Department of Health and Human Services said Monday that it is referring Harvard University for administrative suspension and debarment proceedings, a move that would exclude the school from entering into contracts with all government agencies or receiving federal funding.
title: US Recommends Harvard Be Excluded From Federal Funding, HHS Says

author: Gregory Korte
description: Federal agencies are preparing for a possible government shutdown with detailed plans that call for temporary furloughs but not permanent mass firings — even after the White House pressed departments to consider reductions in force as part of their contingency planning.
title: US Plans Thousands of Shutdown Furloughs But Silent on Firings

author: Paul Richardson, Skylar Woodhouse
description: The Trump administration supports a one-year extension of the African Growth and Opportunity Act, according to a White House official, offering a boost to the decades-old trade pact set to expire at the end of the month.
title: White House Supports One-Year Extension of Africa Trade Pact

author: Catherine Lucey, Ethan Bronner
description: President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said they had agreed to a 20-point plan designed to end the war in Gaza, though the prospects for peace remained unclear without the direct involvement of Hamas.
title: Trump Says Netanyahu Agreed to 20-Point Plan to End War in Gaza

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: The 22-year-old man accused of killing conservative commentator Charlie Kirk earlier this month will appear in a Utah court Oct. 30, after a judge granted a request from his defense lawyer for more time to review “voluminous” evidence state prosecutors have compiled.
title: Charlie Kirk Shooting Suspect to Return to Utah Court in October

author: Ellen Milligan
description: Chancellor the Exchequer Rachel Reeves signaled she’s open to raising taxes on the UK’s gambling industry, setting the stage for a possible move to lift a controversial cap on benefits for parents.
title: Rachel Reeves Hints at UK Gambling Tax Rises in November Budget

author: Fiona MacDonald, Eric Martin
description: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called Qatar’s prime minister on Monday to apologize for a deadly missile strike this month that targeted Hamas figures in Doha.
title: Netanyahu Said to Apologize to Qatar for Deadly Israel Missile Strike

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: Foreign workers in the UK will need twice as long to quality for permanent residency, Labour announced on Monday, and migrants will be need to pass a “series of new tests” to prove they can be good citizens.
title: Foreign Workers Wanting to Settle in UK Face Tougher New Tests

author: Patricia Laya
description: Colombia’s foreign minister said she’ll renounce her US visa in an “act of dignity” after Washington revoked President Gustavo Petro’s permit.
title: Colombia’s Top Diplomat Renounces US Visa as Relations Sour

author: Alex Morales
description: Greater Manchester Mayor Andy Burnham quashed speculation that he’s seeking to replace Keir Starmer as he sought to draw a line under a week in which he’s directly challenged the UK prime minister’s stewardship.
title: ‘I Can’t Run:’ Andy Burnham Retreats From Labour Leadership Push

author: John Ainger
description: Sweden will oppose a push by Germany to water down the European Union’s 2035 deadline to effectively ban combustion engines in new vehicles, arguing that such a move would punish those carmakers that have made major investments in the green transition.
title: Sweden Hits Back at Merz Call to Lift EU Combustion Engine Ban

author: Hugo Miller, Allegra Catelli, Catherine Lucey, Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland has offered to invest in US gold refining, as it tries to persuade the Trump administration to lower tariffs
title: Swiss Offer Trump Sweetener on Gold to Get Better Tariff Deal

author: Max Ramsay, Andrea Palasciano
description: European Union leaders meeting in Copenhagen this week will discuss a slate of flagship defense projects, including a European drone wall and an air defense shield.
title: EU Leaders to Discuss Drone Wall After Russia Aircraft Incursion

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Mario Parker
description: The Cost Coalition, a bipartisan group of Donald Trump adversaries, is throwing its support behind Virginia Democratic gubernatorial candidate Abigail Spanberger, who has largely centered her campaign pitch to voters on addressing worries over affordability.
title: Trump Critics Back Spanberger’s Affordability Pitch in Virginia

author: Liz Capo McCormick
description: Prolonged government shutdowns have historically lifted prices for long-dated Treasuries, according to Citigroup, providing a potential upside for bond investors as the US hurdles toward another potential closure.
title: Long Government Shutdown May Boost US Treasuries, Citi Says

author: James Booth
description: The City of London Corporation elected Susan Langley as the 697th lord mayor of London.
title: City of London Elects Susan Langley as the Next Lord Mayor

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he would levy new tariffs to boost the domestic film and furniture industries through a pair of sweeping, yet confusing, plans.
title: Trump Threatens Fresh Tariffs Related to Furniture, Movies

author: Andrea Dudik, Peter Laca
description: Billionaire politician Andrej Babis looks set to return as the Czech Republic’s prime minister, propelled by a populist election campaign infused with Donald Trump-style rhetoric.
title: How Election Win for Czech Billionaire Babis Would Impact EU Ties

author: Nathan Risser, Eliyahu Kamisher
description: Last year, Governor Gavin Newsom stood before Californians and declared the oil industry the “polluted heart of this climate crisis.” Big Oil, he said, was lying, manipulating and profiteering. “They’re screwing you,” he added, after signing a bill to bolster oversight.
title: Newsom Courts Big Oil as Gas Prices Threaten Political Ambitions

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Incumbent Francesco Acquaroli, an ally of Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, was leading early results in the election for the next governor of the region of Marche.
title: Meloni-Backed Candidate in Slight Lead in Local Italian Election

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Donald Trump said he would seek to deny federal funds to New York City if mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani was elected, in the president’s latest bid to rally voters against the Democratic nominee a day after current Mayor Eric Adams said he would end his reelection bid.
title: Trump Threatens NYC Funding Over Mamdani After Adams Drops Out

author: Joe Mayes
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said Nigel Farage and his Reform UK Party is the “single greatest threat” to working people in Britain, as she issued a rallying call to her party to fight the populist right.
title: Reeves Declares Farage ‘Greatest Threat’ in Bid to Rally Labour

author: Zoltan Simon, Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungary’s statistics office significantly revised one of its poverty indicators after criticism over methodology that showed improved social trends under Prime Minister Viktor Orban.
title: Hungary Amends Poverty Stat After Criticism Over Skewed Data

author: Paul Vecchiatto
description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana questioned the affordability of providing free public healthcare to undocumented migrants and said state departments should be reformed to curb waste.
title: South Africa Minister Questions Free Care for Undocumented Migrants

author: Souhail Karam, Srinivasan Sivabalan
description: Morocco’s sovereign bonds rose after S&P Global Ratings awarded the kingdom the only investment-grade rating for a Eurobond issuer in Africa, boosting its fundraising power ahead of the 2030 soccer World Cup.
title: Moroccan Bonds Rise After S&P Awards Coveted Investment Grade

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Former Thai premier Thaksin Shinawatra has submitted a petition seeking a royal pardon, just weeks after a court ordered him to serve a one-year sentence over a past conviction.
title: Jailed Former Thai PM Thaksin Makes Fresh Plea for Royal Pardon

author: Erik Wasson
description: President Donald Trump and top congressional leaders have strong political incentives to stoke the ongoing stalemate during a White House meeting Monday even as they drive the US to its first government shutdown in nearly seven years.
title: Expectations for Trump Summit Low Before Shutdown Deadline

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime minister under pressure from poll-leading Reform just 15 months after landslide election victory.
title: Enfeebled Starmer Takes Aim at Britain’s Populists

author: Sanne Wass, Michael Nienaber
description: Denmark is receiving security assistance from NATO allies ahead of a high-level meeting of European leaders in Copenhagen this week after a wave of drone incursions disrupted civilian and military sites.
title: Denmark Calls In NATO Help for EU Summit After Drone Incursions

author: Craig Stirling
description: Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said inflation that could stay above target until 2028 is a concern for her as she argues against interest-rate cuts.
title: Fed’s Hammack Is Still Worried About Outlook for US Inflation

author: Joe Mayes, Lizzy Burden
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves ruled out a UK wealth tax, while also giving one of her strongest commitments yet to abide by campaign pledges not to raise the level of several key taxes.
title: UK Doesn’t Need Standalone Wealth Tax, Chancellor Reeves Says

author: Daniele Lepido
description: Italy has closed a probe into whether Pirelli & C SpA’s largest shareholder, Sinochem Holdings Corp., violated restrictions on its role at the tiremaker aimed at limiting Chinese influence over strategic assets.
title: Italy Drops Probe Into Influence of Top Shareholder Sinochem

author: Debby Wu, Edwin Chan
description: Washington is demanding Taiwan move investment and chip production to the US so half of American demand is manufactured locally, outlining a radical shift for the global semiconductor industry.
title: Taiwan Must Help US to Make Half its Chips, Commerce Chief Says

author: Toru Fujioka
description: A dovish Bank of Japan board member pointed to the rising need for an interest rate hike, signaling broadening support for action, although he also tempered his message by highlighting continued risks from abroad.
title: Dovish BOJ Member Sees Rising Need for Hike While Noting Risks

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: China’s ruling Communist Party will convene a closed-door meeting from Oct. 20 to 23 to review development plans for the next five years, the official Xinhua News Agency said on Monday, citing a meeting of the top decision body Politburo.
title: China to Hold Plenum on Five-Year Plan From Oct 20 to 23

author: Jenny Leonard, Eric Martin
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping is renewing a push for the US to change a decades-old phrase describing its stance on Taiwan independence, a concession that would be a major diplomatic win for Beijing.
title: Xi Pushes Trump to ‘Oppose’ Taiwan Independence in Major Shift

author: Sakura Murakami
description: With less than a week until Japan’s ruling party is set to elect a new leader, opinion polls are split over whether political scion Shinjiro Koizumi or right-leaning Sanae Takaichi has the most backing among the party’s supporters.
title: Japan Polls Split on Whether Koizumi or Takaichi Leads LDP Race

author: Rakesh Sharma, Weilun Soon, Siddhi Nayak
description: Two months after sanctions plunged Indian refiner Nayara Energy Ltd. into crisis, upending trade and forcing the abrupt exit of its European executives, the company’s operations and sales are recovering, thanks to government support and workarounds.
title: Sanction-Hit Indian Refiner Nayara Is Clawing Its Way Back

author: Tara Patel, William Horobin, Claudia Cohen
description: One way or another, the taxman is coming for France’s wealthiest citizens.
title: France Takes Aim at Wealthy as Way Out of Political Paralysis

author: Alan Wong
description: Nathan Law, a former Hong Kong lawmaker and pro-democracy activist, said he was denied entry into Singapore after arriving in the city on Saturday for a conference.
title: Hong Kong Activist Nathan Law Says He Was Denied Singapore Entry

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s premier started the countdown to dissolve parliament in four months and hold elections early next year, setting the stage for another round of political jockeying between the royalist establishment he represents and the upstart reform movement that has challenged the status quo.
title: Anutin Starts Clock on Dissolving Thai Parliament by January

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s government rushed to restore digital services after a fire at its main data hub crippled operations nationwide, with President Lee Jae Myung apologizing to the public and pledging sweeping reforms to strengthen the country’s digital infrastructure.
title: South Korea Races to Restore National Digital System After Fire
